intro: Crotalaria microcarpa var. sudanica, commonly known as Sudanese crotalaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is an erect, annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, pinnately compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are yellow, clustered in racemes, and are characteristic of the genus Crotalaria. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
